answers.answer: Use the computer, ignore the floater. Allmost 50% of people over 50 and 75% of people over 75 have floaters. Most can "tune them out" with neuroadaptation.Get use to it. There is no RX for floaters that is safe.JCH MD

question: I have type II diabetes so I visit my ophthalmologist frequently.Last year I started to see "floaters" and "lighting strikes" from the sides of my right eye. I was fortunate enough not to have retinal detachment and in time it went away except for one floater that is long and sometimes gets right in front of my eye. My problem is the computer and sometimes reading. The floater makes it difficult to focus. I have asked my eye doctor about this he said to just limit my computer use. Any ideas.thanks
title: eye floater and computer
